title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: ALccdfDB links four administrative data modules enriched, analysis-ready datasets. linkage layer connects programs enrolled children (facility_id), subsidy clients (provider_id), Alabama Pathways staff records (facility_name, case-insensitive). reverse linkage also appends program attributes onto individual client rows spatial analysis. Four linkage types available: Programs x Enrolled – aggregate enrollment counts onto programs Programs x Clients – aggregate client counts copay onto programs Programs x Staff – aggregate staff counts career levels onto programs Clients x Programs – append program attributes onto client rows vignette also demonstrates Melissa geocoding output DuckDB integration persistent storage SQL-based querying.

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: synthetic generators share common facility pool called seed, ensuring facility_id, provider_id, facility_name overlap across modules enable linkage.
code: library(ALccdfDB) library(dplyr) #> Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.5.2 #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following object is masked from 'package:ALccdfDB': #>  #>     db_list_tables #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2) #> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.5.2  seed <- 42 programs <- alccdf_synthetic_programs(n = 50, seed = seed) subsidy  <- alccdf_synthetic_subsidy(n_enrolled = 80, n_clients = 40, seed = seed) staff    <- alccdf_synthetic_staff(n = 60, seed = seed) melissa  <- alccdf_synthetic_melissa(programs = programs, seed = seed)

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: running linkage, verify shared join keys overlap across modules.
code:
prg_data <- alccdf_data(programs) enr_data <- alccdf_data(subsidy$enrolled) cli_data <- alccdf_data(subsidy$clients) stf_data <- alccdf_data(staff)  # facility_id overlap (programs <-> enrolled) prg_fids <- unique(prg_data$facility_id) enr_fids <- unique(enr_data$facility_id) cat("Programs facility_ids:", length(prg_fids), "
") #> Programs facility_ids: 50 cat("Enrolled facility_ids:", length(enr_fids), "
") #> Enrolled facility_ids: 50 cat("Overlap (facility_id):", length(intersect(prg_fids, enr_fids)), "

") #> Overlap (facility_id): 33  # provider_id overlap (programs <-> clients) prg_pids <- unique(prg_data$provider_id) cli_pids <- unique(cli_data$provider_id) cat("Programs provider_ids:", length(prg_pids), "
") #> Programs provider_ids: 50 cat("Clients provider_ids:", length(cli_pids), "
") #> Clients provider_ids: 32 cat("Overlap (provider_id):", length(intersect(prg_pids, cli_pids)), "

") #> Overlap (provider_id): 32  # facility_name overlap (programs <-> staff, case-insensitive) prg_names <- unique(tolower(trimws(prg_data$facility_name))) stf_names <- unique(tolower(trimws(stf_data$facility_name))) cat("Programs facility_names:", length(prg_names), "
") #> Programs facility_names: 50 cat("Staff facility_names:", length(stf_names), "
") #> Staff facility_names: 37 cat("Overlap (facility_name):", length(intersect(prg_names, stf_names)), "
") #> Overlap (facility_name): 28

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: Link programs enrolled children facility_id. program row preserved (LEFT JOIN) enriched enrollment aggregates: number enrolled children, case counts, care level distribution columns. Inspect new columns added linkage: Figure 1: Distribution Enrolled Children per Program Distribution enrolled children per program Figure 2: Enrolled Children Facility Type Enrolled children facility type
code: linked_pe <- linkage_programs_enrolled(programs, subsidy$enrolled, verbose = FALSE) linked_pe #>  #> ── ALccdfDB Linkage: Programs x Enrolled Children ── #>  #> ℹ Join key: facility_id #> ℹ Backbone: programs #> ℹ Dimensions: 50 rows x 57 cols #> ℹ Programs: 50 #> ℹ Enrolled records: 80 #> ℹ Match rate: 33/50 (66%) #>  #> ── Processing Log #> [2026-02-15 15:55:55] Linked programs x enrolled: 33/50 programs matched (66%), #> 80 enrolled records pe_df <- alccdf_data(linked_pe) new_cols <- c("n_enrolled_children", "n_cases",               grep("^care_level_", names(pe_df), value = TRUE)) head(pe_df[, intersect(c("facility_id", "facility_name", new_cols), names(pe_df))], 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 8 #>    facility_id facility_name  n_enrolled_children n_cases care_level_School Ag…¹ #>    <chr>       <chr>                        <int>   <int>                  <int> #>  1 FX001       JSU Child Lea…                   0       0                     NA #>  2 FX002       Gadsden State…                   1       1                      1 #>  3 FC001       Jubilee Child…                   1       1                      1 #>  4 FG001       Lakeside Grou…                   2       2                      1 #>  5 FE001       New Hope Chur…                   1       1                      0 #>  6 FE002       Emmanuel Luth…                   0       0                     NA #>  7 FF001       Hall Family D…                   0       0                     NA #>  8 FC002       Happy Hearts …                   0       0                     NA #>  9 FF002       Walker Home C…                   2       2                      1 #> 10 FF003       Smith Family …                   1       1                      1 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​`care_level_School Age` #> # ℹ 3 more variables: care_level_PreSchool <int>, care_level_Toddler <int>, #> #   care_level_Infant <int> pe_plot <- pe_df[!is.na(pe_df$n_enrolled_children), ]  ggplot(pe_plot, aes(x = n_enrolled_children)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 1, fill = "#4292C6", color = "white") +   labs(     title = "Enrolled Children per Program",     x = "Number of Enrolled Children",     y = "Count of Programs"   ) +   theme_minimal() ggplot(pe_plot, aes(x = facility_type, y = n_enrolled_children)) +   geom_boxplot(fill = "#9ECAE1", outlier.color = "#084594") +   labs(     title = "Enrolled Children by Facility Type",     x = "Facility Type",     y = "Number of Enrolled Children"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 30, hjust = 1))

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: Link programs subsidy clients (Active Clients Addresses) provider_id. Aggregated columns include n_active_clients, avg_copay_weekly, n_unique_cases.
code: linked_pc <- linkage_programs_clients(programs, subsidy$clients, verbose = FALSE) linked_pc #>  #> ── ALccdfDB Linkage: Programs x Subsidy Clients ── #>  #> ℹ Join key: provider_id #> ℹ Backbone: programs #> ℹ Dimensions: 50 rows x 54 cols #> ℹ Programs: 50 #> ℹ Client records: 40 #> ℹ Match rate: 32/50 (64%) #>  #> ── Processing Log #> [2026-02-15 15:55:56] Linked programs x clients: 32/50 programs matched (64%), #> 40 client records pc_df <- alccdf_data(linked_pc) head(pc_df[, c("facility_id", "facility_name", "n_active_clients",                "avg_copay_weekly", "n_unique_cases")], 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 5 #>    facility_id facility_name    n_active_clients avg_copay_weekly n_unique_cases #>    <chr>       <chr>                       <int>            <dbl>          <int> #>  1 FX001       JSU Child Learn…                3            35.8               3 #>  2 FX002       Gadsden State C…                0            NA                 0 #>  3 FC001       Jubilee Child C…                2            15.2               2 #>  4 FG001       Lakeside Group …                1            31.2               1 #>  5 FE001       New Hope Church…                1            45.4               1 #>  6 FE002       Emmanuel Luther…                1             8.72              1 #>  7 FF001       Hall Family Day…                0            NA                 0 #>  8 FC002       Happy Hearts Ch…                1             6.19              1 #>  9 FF002       Walker Home Chi…                1             9.57              1 #> 10 FF003       Smith Family Ch…                0            NA                 0

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: Link programs Alabama Pathways staff data facility_name (case-insensitive, whitespace-trimmed). Adds n_staff career lattice level distribution columns. Figure 3: Mean Staff per Program Facility Type Mean staff count per program facility type
code: linked_ps <- linkage_programs_staff(programs, staff, verbose = FALSE) linked_ps #>  #> ── ALccdfDB Linkage: Programs x Staff ── #>  #> ℹ Join key: facility_name (case-insensitive, trimmed) #> ℹ Backbone: programs #> ℹ Dimensions: 50 rows x 57 cols #> ℹ Programs: 50 #> ℹ Staff records: 60 #> ℹ Match rate: 28/50 (56%) #>  #> ── Processing Log #> [2026-02-15 15:55:56] Linked programs x staff: 28/50 programs matched (56%), 60 #> staff records ps_df <- alccdf_data(linked_ps)  staff_summary <- aggregate(n_staff ~ facility_type, data = ps_df, FUN = mean) staff_summary$n_staff <- round(staff_summary$n_staff, 1)  ggplot(staff_summary, aes(x = reorder(facility_type, n_staff), y = n_staff)) +   geom_col(fill = "#74C476") +   geom_text(aes(label = n_staff), hjust = -0.2, size = 3.5) +   coord_flip() +   labs(     title = "Mean Staff per Program by Facility Type",     x = "Facility Type",     y = "Mean Number of Staff"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: reverse linkage appends program-level attributes (facility type, tier, coordinates, capacity, etc.) onto individual client rows. useful spatial analysis comparing household program locations.
code: linked_cp <- linkage_clients_programs(subsidy$clients, programs, verbose = FALSE) linked_cp #>  #> ── ALccdfDB Linkage: Clients x Programs ── #>  #> ℹ Join key: provider_id #> ℹ Backbone: clients #> ℹ Dimensions: 40 rows x 33 cols #> ℹ Clients: 40 #> ℹ Programs: 50 #> ℹ Match rate: 40/40 (100%) #> ℹ Program columns appended: facility_id, facility_name, facility_type, facility_tier, facility_address, county, region, day_capacity, night_capacity, day_age_range, night_age_range, day_start, day_end, night_start, night_end, expiration_date, days_till_expire, license_number, snapshot_date #>  #> ── Processing Log #> [2026-02-15 15:55:56] Linked clients x programs: 40/40 client rows matched #> (100%), 19 program columns appended cp_df <- alccdf_data(linked_cp) prog_cols <- intersect(   c("provider_id", "family_address", "facility_name", "facility_type", "county"),   names(cp_df) ) head(cp_df[, prog_cols], 8) #> # A tibble: 8 × 5 #>   provider_id family_address                  facility_name facility_type county #>   <chr>       <chr>                           <chr>         <fct>         <chr>  #> 1 P0004       2442 Cypress Circle, Florence,… Lakeside Gro… Group Home    Calho… #> 2 P0001       2997 Walnut Avenue, Alabaster,… JSU Child Le… Excepted (Un… St. C… #> 3 P0020       842 Oak Lane, Alabaster, AL 35… Pleasant Hil… Faith-Based   Dale   #> 4 P0048       8066 Elm Street, Florence, AL … Grace Commun… Faith-Based   Houst… #> 5 P0044       1669 Pecan Drive, Mobile, AL 3… Calhoun Comm… Excepted (Un… St. C… #> 6 P0042       6738 Pine Way, Mobile, AL 36602 Dogwood Lear… Center        Montg… #> 7 P0038       523 Cypress Circle, Huntsville… ABC Learning… Center        St. C… #> 8 P0023       6690 Birch Road, Dothan, AL 36… Auburn Unive… Excepted (Un… St. C…

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: Compare match rates across four linkage types. summary built manually since metadata structure differs linkage types.
code: diag_summary <- tibble::tibble(   Linkage = c(     "Programs x Enrolled",     "Programs x Clients",     "Programs x Staff",     "Clients x Programs"   ),   Join_Key = c(     "facility_id",     "provider_id",     "facility_name",     "provider_id"   ),   n_matched = c(     linked_pe$meta$n_matched,     linked_pc$meta$n_matched,     linked_ps$meta$n_matched,     linked_cp$meta$n_matched   ),   n_total = c(     linked_pe$meta$n_programs,     linked_pc$meta$n_programs,     linked_ps$meta$n_programs,     linked_cp$meta$n_linked   ),   match_rate_pct = c(     linked_pe$meta$match_rate,     linked_pc$meta$match_rate,     linked_ps$meta$match_rate,     linked_cp$meta$match_rate   ) )  diag_summary #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>   Linkage             Join_Key      n_matched n_total match_rate_pct #>   <chr>               <chr>             <int>   <int>          <dbl> #> 1 Programs x Enrolled facility_id          33      50             66 #> 2 Programs x Clients  provider_id          32      50             64 #> 3 Programs x Staff    facility_name        28      50             56 #> 4 Clients x Programs  provider_id          40      40            100

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: Melissa geocoding module provides latitude, longitude, census tract, FIPS code, address standardization program household addresses. synthetic generator produces realistic Alabama coordinates within state bounding box. Figure 4: Geocoded Program Locations Scatter plot geocoded program locations across Alabama
code: head(melissa$programs, 8) #> # A tibble: 8 × 15 #>   facility_address        latitude longitude census_tract census_block fips_code #>   <chr>                      <dbl>     <dbl>        <dbl>        <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 4991 MCFARLAND BOULEVA…     31.7     -85.7       816614         9727      1097 #> 2 6873 MCFARLAND BOULEVA…     30.3     -86.4       574227         2495      1069 #> 3 3208 HIGHLAND AVENUE, …     31.9     -85.4       767203         4334      1103 #> 4 9453 QUINTARD AVENUE, …     31.9     -86.3       691108         2268      1081 #> 5 2920 HIGHLAND AVENUE, …     32.1     -85.5       859017         1865      1073 #> 6 4273 MEMORIAL PARKWAY,…     32.6     -87.9       621691         4348      1003 #> 7 4721 DEXTER AVENUE, AL…     34.3     -84.9       777938         1043      1055 #> 8 3839 FAIRVIEW AVENUE, …     30.4     -85.4       667786         6534      1003 #> # ℹ 9 more variables: melissa_county <chr>, melissa_place <chr>, #> #   melissa_place_code <int>, melissa_city <chr>, melissa_state <chr>, #> #   melissa_zip <chr>, melissa_geo_zip <chr>, melissa_result_code <chr>, #> #   melissa_status_code <chr> ggplot(melissa$programs, aes(x = longitude, y = latitude)) +   geom_point(color = "#E6550D", alpha = 0.7, size = 2.5) +   labs(     title = "Geocoded Program Locations",     subtitle = "Synthetic Melissa output for Alabama CCDF programs",     x = "Longitude",     y = "Latitude"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: Store processed data DuckDB database efficient querying persistent snapshots. database module supports writing S3 object via db_write_snapshot() querying standard SQL.
code: db_path <- tempfile(fileext = ".duckdb") conn <- db_init(db_path, verbose = FALSE) # Write program, enrolled, and staff snapshots db_write_snapshot(conn, programs, "programs", verbose = FALSE) db_write_snapshot(conn, subsidy$enrolled, "enrolled", verbose = FALSE) db_write_snapshot(conn, staff, "staff", verbose = FALSE)  ALccdfDB::db_list_tables(conn) #> [1] "enrolled" "programs" "staff"

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
code: # Programs by county: count and average day capacity db_query(conn, "   SELECT county, COUNT(*) AS n_programs,          ROUND(AVG(day_capacity), 0) AS avg_day_capacity   FROM programs   GROUP BY county   ORDER BY n_programs DESC   LIMIT 10 ", verbose = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    county     n_programs avg_day_capacity #>    <chr>           <dbl>            <dbl> #>  1 St. Clair           5               97 #>  2 Morgan              4               43 #>  3 Calhoun             4               48 #>  4 Mobile              4               50 #>  5 Tuscaloosa          3               68 #>  6 DeKalb              3               36 #>  7 Lauderdale          3              114 #>  8 Jefferson           3               63 #>  9 Lee                 3               34 #> 10 Shelby              2                6 # Enrollment by care level: count and distinct cases db_query(conn, "   SELECT care_level, COUNT(*) AS n_records,          COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS n_cases   FROM enrolled   GROUP BY care_level   ORDER BY n_records DESC ", verbose = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   care_level n_records n_cases #>   <chr>          <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 School Age        46      46 #> 2 Toddler           15      15 #> 3 PreSchool         15      15 #> 4 Infant             4       4 # Column metadata for the programs table db_table_info(conn, "programs") #> # A tibble: 51 × 3 #>    column_name       column_type description #>    <chr>             <chr>       <chr>       #>  1 facility_id       VARCHAR     NA          #>  2 facility_name     VARCHAR     NA          #>  3 facility_type_raw VARCHAR     NA          #>  4 facility_type     VARCHAR     NA          #>  5 facility_tier     VARCHAR     NA          #>  6 county            VARCHAR     NA          #>  7 region            VARCHAR     NA          #>  8 facility_address  VARCHAR     NA          #>  9 facility_address2 VARCHAR     NA          #> 10 provider_id       VARCHAR     NA          #> # ℹ 41 more rows db_close(conn) #> ℹ Database connection closed unlink(db_path)

title: Cross-Module Linkage and Database Integration
text: Export linked datasets multiple formats use Stata, Excel, tools:
code: # CSV linkage_programs_enrolled_export_csv(linked_pe, "output/linkage/programs_enrolled.csv")  # Excel linkage_programs_enrolled_export_excel(linked_pe, "output/linkage/programs_enrolled.xlsx")  # Stata linkage_programs_enrolled_export_stata(linked_pe, "output/linkage/programs_enrolled.dta")  # RDS (preserves S3 classes and factor levels) linkage_programs_enrolled_export_rds(linked_pe, "output/linkage/programs_enrolled.rds")  # All formats at once linkage_programs_enrolled_export_all(linked_pe, "output/linkage/", "programs_enrolled")

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: vignette demonstrates end--end ALccdfDB workflow across three data modules: programs, subsidy, staff. Starting synthetic data generation, walk data inspection, visualization, validation, summary statistics, export. Every function call shown mirrors exact steps use real Alabama CCDF administrative data files.

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: ALccdfDB provides synthetic data generators produce realistic datasets matching structure column types real administrative data. Using shared seed ensures facility identities consistent across modules, enabling cross-module linkage.
code: programs <- alccdf_synthetic_programs(n = 50, seed = 42) subsidy  <- alccdf_synthetic_subsidy(n_enrolled = 80, n_clients = 40, seed = 42) staff    <- alccdf_synthetic_staff(n = 60, seed = 42)

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: program module backbone CCDF data system. contains facility-level information including type, tier rating, capacity, operating hours, age ranges served, quality-adjusted capacity measures.

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: program object S3 object $data, $meta, $diagnostics components. Use alccdf_data() extract underlying tibble.

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: Alabama child care programs fall five categories: Centers (common), Family Homes, Group Homes, Faith-Based (exempt), Excepted (university/) programs. Figure 1: Distribution facility types
code: prog_df <- alccdf_data(programs)  type_counts <- prog_df %>%   count(facility_type) %>%   arrange(n)  ggplot(type_counts, aes(x = reorder(facility_type, n), y = n)) +   geom_col(fill = "steelblue") +   geom_text(aes(label = n), hjust = -0.2, size = 3.5) +   coord_flip() +   labs(     title = "Number of Facilities by Type",     x = NULL,     y = "Count"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(plot.title = element_text(face = "bold"))

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: Capacity varies substantially facility type. Centers tend largest capacities, Family Homes capped much smaller numbers. Figure 2: Day capacity distribution facility type
code: ggplot(prog_df, aes(x = facility_type, y = day_capacity)) +   geom_boxplot(fill = "lightblue", outlier.colour = "red", outlier.size = 2) +   labs(     title = "Day Capacity by Facility Type",     x = "Facility Type",     y = "Day Capacity"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 30, hjust = 1),     plot.title = element_text(face = "bold")   )

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: Alabama Quality STARS rating system assigns tiers (Star 1 Star 5) eligible programs. Faith-Based Excepted programs rated, exclude NA tiers view. Figure 3: Tier proportions facility type
code: tier_df <- prog_df %>%   filter(!is.na(facility_tier))  ggplot(tier_df, aes(x = facility_type, fill = facility_tier)) +   geom_bar(position = "fill") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format()) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "YlOrRd", name = "Tier") +   labs(     title = "Tier Proportions by Facility Type",     x = "Facility Type",     y = "Proportion"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 30, hjust = 1),     plot.title = element_text(face = "bold")   )

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: ALccdfDB computes three quality-adjusted capacity measures using different weighting schemes: linear (proportional tier), binary (high-quality vs. ), exponential (accelerating reward higher tiers). Quality-adjusted capacity tier
code: quality_table <- prog_df %>%   filter(!is.na(facility_tier)) %>%   group_by(facility_tier) %>%   summarise(     n = n(),     mean_capacity   = round(mean(day_capacity, na.rm = TRUE), 1),     mean_qa_linear  = round(mean(capacity_qa_linear, na.rm = TRUE), 1),     mean_qa_binary  = round(mean(capacity_qa_binary, na.rm = TRUE), 1),     .groups = "drop"   )  knitr::kable(   quality_table,   caption = "Quality-adjusted capacity by tier",   col.names = c("Tier", "N", "Mean Capacity", "QA Linear", "QA Binary") )

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: program serves one age groups. three binary indicators (day_age_infants_toddlers, day_age_preschool, day_age_school_aged) identify populations facility covers. Figure 4: Age group coverage across facilities
code: age_long <- prog_df %>%   select(facility_id, day_age_infants_toddlers, day_age_preschool,          day_age_school_aged) %>%   pivot_longer(     cols = c(day_age_infants_toddlers, day_age_preschool, day_age_school_aged),     names_to = "age_group",     values_to = "serves"   ) %>%   mutate(     age_group = case_when(       age_group == "day_age_infants_toddlers" ~ "Infants & Toddlers",       age_group == "day_age_preschool"        ~ "Preschool",       age_group == "day_age_school_aged"      ~ "School Aged"     )   )  age_summary <- age_long %>%   group_by(age_group) %>%   summarise(n_serving = sum(serves, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(age_summary, aes(x = reorder(age_group, n_serving), y = n_serving)) +   geom_col(fill = "darkorange") +   geom_text(aes(label = n_serving), hjust = -0.2, size = 3.5) +   coord_flip() +   labs(     title = "Number of Facilities Serving Each Age Group",     x = NULL,     y = "Number of Facilities"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(plot.title = element_text(face = "bold"))

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: subsidy module handles two related datasets: enrolled children (placement-level records linking children providers) clients (family-level records funding copayment details). use PII separation keep sensitive fields isolated analytic data.

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: key design principle ALccdfDB personally identifiable information (names, SSNs) stored separate $pii table, never main $data tibble. allows analysts work data without inadvertent exposure sensitive fields.

cat("Data columns:", ncol(alccdf_data(enrolled)), "
") #> Data columns: 17 cat("PII columns: ", ncol(enrolled$pii), "
") #> PII columns:  6 cat("PII field names:", paste(names(enrolled$pii), collapse = ", "), "
") #> PII field names: parent_id, child_id, parent_name, child_name, parent_ssn, child_ssn

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: ALccdfDB includes validation functions module run battery data quality checks. validator returns structured result object reporting PASS, WARN, ERROR, INFO statuses across multiple checks. Subsidy staff modules validators checks tailored data structures.
code: prog_validation <- program_validate(programs, verbose = FALSE) prog_validation #>  #> ── ALccdfDB Validation Report: program ── #>  #> ℹ Status: ✔ PASSED #> ℹ Snapshot: 2026-02-15 #> ℹ Checks: 10 total #> ! Warnings: 1 #> ℹ Info: 1 #> ✔ [PASS] All required columns present #> ✔ [PASS] No duplicate facility IDs #> ⚠ [WARN] Non-positive capacity values found (48 issues) #> ✔ [PASS] County: 23 unique values (factor) #> ✔ [PASS] Expiration dates within expected range #> ✔ [PASS] Operating hours within 0-24 range #> ℹ [INFO] Age range columns not present (skipped) #> ✔ [PASS] All facility addresses present #> ✔ [PASS] Facility tiers valid (Star 1-5 or NA) #> ✔ [PASS] Snapshot date present on all rows sub_validation   <- subsidy_validate(enrolled, verbose = FALSE) staff_validation <- staff_validate(staff, verbose = FALSE)  sub_validation #>  #> ── ALccdfDB Validation Report: subsidy ── #>  #> ℹ Status: ✔ PASSED #> ℹ Snapshot: 2026-02-15 #> ℹ Checks: 7 total #> ✖ Errors: 1 #> ℹ Info: 2 #> ✘ [ERROR] Missing required columns (3 issues) #> ℹ [INFO] No address columns present (skipped) #> ℹ [INFO] Copayment check not applicable for enrolled data #> ✔ [PASS] All child ages in reasonable range (0-18) #> ✔ [PASS] All records have provider_id #> ✔ [PASS] No duplicate records on [case_id, facility_id] #> ✔ [PASS] PII fields properly separated from main data staff_validation #>  #> ── ALccdfDB Validation Report: staff ── #>  #> ℹ Status: ✔ PASSED #> ℹ Snapshot: 2026-02-15 #> ℹ Checks: 4 total #> ! Warnings: 1 #> ✔ [PASS] All required columns present #> ✔ [PASS] No duplicate name + facility combinations #> ⚠ [WARN] Unexpected career lattice levels found (60 issues) #> ✔ [PASS] PII fields (staff_name, user_email) not in main data

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: ALccdfDB supports five output formats module: CSV, Excel, Stata (.dta), Parquet, RDS. Subsidy staff exports default PII-excluded mode safety.
code: # Program exports program_export_csv(programs, "output/programs.csv") program_export_excel(programs, "output/programs.xlsx") program_export_stata(programs, "output/programs.dta") program_export_parquet(programs, "output/programs.parquet") program_export_rds(programs, "output/programs.rds")  # Subsidy exports (PII excluded by default) subsidy_export_csv(enrolled, "output/enrolled.csv") subsidy_export_excel(enrolled, "output/enrolled.xlsx")  # Staff exports (PII excluded by default) staff_export_csv(staff, "output/staff.csv") staff_export_excel(staff, "output/staff.xlsx")  # Export all formats at once program_export_all(programs, dir = "output", basename = "programs_2025")

title: Complete Data Processing Pipeline
text: working actual DHR administrative files, workflow starts configuration reads Excel source files. pipeline follows sequence: configure –> read –> clean –> append –> validate –> export.
code: # 1. Configure the pipeline with file paths and snapshot date cfg <- program_config(   snapshot_date = "2025-06-11",   center_path   = "data-raw/Centers_06_11_25.xlsx",   home_path     = "data-raw/FamilyGroupHomes_06_11_25.xlsx",   exempt_path   = "data-raw/ExemptCenters_06_11_25.xlsx",   excepted_path = "data-raw/ExceptedPrograms_06_11_25.xlsx",   output_dir    = "output/2025-06-11" )  # 2. Read all program types from Excel raw_list <- program_read_all(cfg)  # 3. Clean all program types clean_list <- program_clean_all(raw_list)  # 4. Append into a unified dataset unified <- program_append_types(clean_list)  # 5. Validate validation <- program_validate(unified)  # 6. Summary statistics stats <- program_summary_stats(unified) stats$overview stats$by_type  # 7. Export to all formats program_export_all(   unified,   dir      = "output/2025-06-11",   basename = "all_programs_2025-06-11" )

title: Getting Started with ALccdfDB
text: ALccdfDB modular R package processing, cleaning, validating, managing Alabama CCDF (Child Care Development Fund) administrative data received Alabama Department Human Resources (DHR). package ingests heterogeneous Excel reports covering licensed childcare centers, family group homes, faith-based exempt facilities, license-excepted programs, subsidy enrollment client records, Alabama Pathways staff registry data, Melissa.com geocoding results. data source follows format, ALccdfDB provides data-driven column mappings adapt automatically. complete processing pipeline transforms raw files analysis-ready, linked, geocoded panel datasets:
code: DHR Excel Files           Processing Pipeline               Output -------------------       ----------------------------      ------------------ Licensed Centers    -->   Read   -->  Clean   -->  Validate Family/Group Homes  -->   (S3 obj)   (S3 obj)    (S3 obj) Faith-Based Exempt  -->                  | License Excepted    -->            Append Types              Analysis-ready                                          |                   tibbles Subsidy (Enrolled)  -->            Deduplicate Subsidy (Clients)   -->                  |                   CSV / Excel /                                      Melissa  -->  Linkage   Stata / Parquet Staff Pathways      -->            (Geocode)   (Cross-module)                                                      | Melissa Geocoding   -->                          Export / Database                                                  (DuckDB snapshots)

title: Getting Started with ALccdfDB
Getting Started with ALccdfDB
text: ALccdfDB includes synthetic data generators produce realistic datasets without requiring access confidential DHR files. generators share facility pool called seed, enabling cross-module linkage. S3 print method shows compact summary object: Extract underlying data tibble alccdf_data() inspect key columns:
code: # Generate synthetic data for all three primary modules programs <- alccdf_synthetic_programs(n = 50, seed = 42) subsidy  <- alccdf_synthetic_subsidy(n_enrolled = 80, n_clients = 40, seed = 42) staff    <- alccdf_synthetic_staff(n = 60, seed = 42) programs #>  #> ── ALccdfDB Program Data (Clean) ── #>  #> ℹ Type: synthetic #> ℹ Snapshot: 2026-02-15 #> ℹ Dimensions: 50 rows x 51 cols #> ℹ Raw rows: 50 #> ℹ Columns: facility_id, facility_name, facility_type_raw, facility_type, facility_tier, county, region, facility_address, facility_address2, provider_id, license_number, day_start, day_end, night_start, night_end, day_capacity, night_capacity, has_day_capacity, has_night_capacity, total_capacity, night_to_day_ratio, day_age_range, day_age_min, day_age_max, day_age_range_num, day_age_infants_toddlers, day_age_preschool, day_age_school_aged, night_age_range, night_age_min, night_age_max, day_operating_hours, night_operating_hours, operation_type, expiration_date, current_date, days_till_expire, facility_tier_original, was_originally_rated, is_high_quality, tier_weight_linear, tier_weight_binary, tier_weight_exp, capacity_qa_linear, capacity_qa_binary, capacity_qa_exp, capacity_flag, snapshot_date, phone_number, director_name, consultant head(alccdf_data(programs)[, c("facility_id", "facility_name",                                 "facility_type", "facility_tier",                                 "county", "day_capacity")]) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   facility_id facility_name      facility_type facility_tier county day_capacity #>   <chr>       <chr>              <fct>         <ord>         <fct>         <int> #> 1 FX001       JSU Child Learnin… Excepted (Un… NA            St. C…           39 #> 2 FX002       Gadsden State Chi… Excepted (Un… NA            Morgan           42 #> 3 FC001       Jubilee Child Car… Center        Star 3        Jeffe…          119 #> 4 FG001       Lakeside Group Ho… Group Home    Star 4        Calho…            7 #> 5 FE001       New Hope Church D… Faith-Based   NA            DeKalb           55 #> 6 FE002       Emmanuel Lutheran… Faith-Based   NA            Elmore           40

title: Getting Started with ALccdfDB
text: ALccdfDB uses internally defined factor levels categorical variables, ensuring consistency across cleaning, validation, export. Use codebook functions inspect canonical levels:

title: Getting Started with ALccdfDB
text: actual DHR Excel files, processing workflow follows structured configure-read-clean-validate-append-deduplicate pipeline:
code: # 1. Configure paths and snapshot date cfg <- program_config(   snapshot_date = "2025-06-11",   center_path   = "data/Centers_06_11_25.xlsx",   home_path     = "data/FamilyGroupHomes_06_11_25.xlsx",   exempt_path   = "data/FaithBasedExempt_06_11_25.xlsx",   excepted_path = "data/LicenseExcepted_06_11_25.xlsx" )  # 2. Read each type (auto-detects format version and column mapping) raw_center  <- program_read(cfg$paths$center,  type = "center",                             snapshot_date = cfg$snapshot_date) raw_home    <- program_read(cfg$paths$home,    type = "family_home",                             snapshot_date = cfg$snapshot_date) raw_exempt  <- program_read(cfg$paths$exempt,  type = "exempt",                             snapshot_date = cfg$snapshot_date) raw_excepted <- program_read(cfg$paths$excepted, type = "excepted",                              snapshot_date = cfg$snapshot_date)  # 3. Clean (standardises addresses, dates, capacity, tiers, factors) clean_center  <- program_clean(raw_center) clean_home    <- program_clean(raw_home) clean_exempt  <- program_clean(raw_exempt) clean_excepted <- program_clean(raw_excepted)  # 4. Validate each type program_validate(clean_center) program_validate(clean_home)  # 5. Append all types into a unified dataset unified <- program_append_types(clean_center, clean_home,                                 clean_exempt, clean_excepted)  # 6. Deduplicate by facility_id deduped <- program_deduplicate(unified)

title: Alabama CCDF Administrative Data Cleaning and Management
Alabama CCDF Administrative Data Cleaning and Management
text: Every module ships synthetic-data generator documentation demos run without access restricted DHR files.
code: library(ALccdfDB)  # ---- Generate synthetic datasets ---- programs <- alccdf_synthetic_programs(n = 50, seed = 42) subsidy  <- alccdf_synthetic_subsidy(n_enrolled = 80, n_clients = 40, seed = 42) staff    <- alccdf_synthetic_staff(n = 60, seed = 42) melissa  <- alccdf_synthetic_melissa(programs = programs, seed = 42)  # ---- Inspect ---- programs subsidy$enrolled subsidy$clients staff melissa

title: Alabama CCDF Administrative Data Cleaning and Management
code: library(ALccdfDB)  # 1 - Configure paths and snapshot date cfg <- program_config(   snapshot_date = "2025-06-11",   center_path   = "data/Centers_06_11_25.xlsx",   home_path     = "data/FamilyGroupHomes_06_11_25.xlsx",   exempt_path   = "data/FaithBasedExempt_06_11_25.xlsx",   excepted_path = "data/LicenseExcepted_06_11_25.xlsx" )  # 2 - Read, clean, validate each facility type raw_center  <- program_read(cfg$paths$center, type = "center",                             snapshot_date = cfg$snapshot_date) clean_center <- program_clean(raw_center) # ... repeat for home, exempt, excepted ...  # 3 - Append all types and deduplicate unified  <- program_append_types(clean_center, clean_home,                                   clean_exempt, clean_excepted) programs <- program_deduplicate(unified)  # 4 - Subsidy pipeline (enrolled + clients) enrolled_raw <- subsidy_read("data/enrollment.xlsx", type = "enrolled",                               snapshot_date = "2025-06-11") enrolled     <- subsidy_clean(enrolled_raw)  # 5 - Staff pipeline staff_raw <- staff_read("data/pathways.csv", snapshot_date = "2025-06-11") stf       <- staff_clean(staff_raw)  # 6 - Melissa geocoding merge melissa_prg <- melissa_import_programs("data/melissa_programs.xlsx") programs    <- melissa_merge_programs(programs, melissa_prg)  # 7 - Cross-module linkage linked_pe <- linkage_programs_enrolled(programs, enrolled) linked_ps <- linkage_programs_staff(programs, stf)  # 8 - Export all formats program_export_all(programs, dir = "output/", basename = "programs_2025")

title: Alabama CCDF Administrative Data Cleaning and Management
code: library(ALccdfDB)  # Initialize database conn <- db_init("alccdf.duckdb")  # Write snapshots db_write_snapshot(conn, programs, "programs") db_write_snapshot(conn, enrolled, "enrolled")  # Inspect tables db_list_tables(conn) db_table_info(conn, "programs")  # SQL queries db_query(conn, "   SELECT county, COUNT(*) AS n_programs,          ROUND(AVG(day_capacity), 0) AS avg_capacity   FROM programs   GROUP BY county   ORDER BY n_programs DESC   LIMIT 10 ")  # Read back snap <- db_read_snapshot(conn, "programs") db_close(conn)

title: Alabama CCDF Administrative Data Cleaning and Management
text: Data-driven column mapping – handles heterogeneous Excel report formats across facility types without hard-coded column positions. Five facility types – Center, Family Home, Group Home, Faith-Based, Excepted facilities processed single unified pipeline. Quality tier recoding – Star 1 Star 5 ordered factor three weighting schemes (linear, binary, exponential). PII separation – Subsidy module cleanly splits personally identifiable information analytic variables. Melissa.com geocoding – imports merges lat/lng, census tract, FIPS codes programs households. Cross-module linkage – purpose-built joins facility_id, provider_id, facility_name (case-insensitive) match-rate diagnostics. DuckDB persistent storage – snapshot-based versioning lets store, query, retrieve point--time datasets. Multi-format export – one-call export CSV, Excel, Stata .dta, Parquet, RDS. Synthetic data generators – every vignette demo runs without restricted data via alccdf_synthetic_*() functions. 23 custom S3 print methods – informative, color-coded console summaries every major object type. Comprehensive test suite – 1,088 expectations across 8 test files; R CMD check passes cleanly.

what: ALccdfDB: Alabama CCDF Administrative Data Cleaning and Management — ALccdfDB-package
title: ALccdfDB: Alabama CCDF Administrative Data Cleaning and Management — ALccdfDB-package
text: modular toolkit cleaning, validating, linking, managing Alabama CCDF (Child Care Development Fund) administrative records Alabama Department Human Resources (DHR). Features data-driven column mapping heterogeneous Excel report formats, purpose-built cross-module linkage diagnostics, Melissa.com geocoding integration (lat/lng, census tract, FIPS), proper factor levels categorical variables, DuckDB-based persistent storage, multiple export formats (CSV, Excel, Stata, Parquet, RDS).

title: Link subsidy clients to program data — linkage_clients_programs
text: linkage designed spatial analysis comparing household locations (client family_address) program locations (program latitude/longitude). linkage pipeline: Extract data objects Select relevant program columns append (avoiding name collisions) LEFT JOIN program data onto clients provider_id Compute match diagnostics Build S3 object Clients without matching program receive NA program columns. client rows preserved. Note: provider_id matches multiple programs, client rows duplicated. diagnostics report expansion.

text: obj alccdf_melissa_programs alccdf_melissa_households object melissa_import_programs melissa_import_households strict Logical; TRUE, ERROR-level failures abort error message. Default FALSE (report ). verbose Logical; print progress messages? Default TRUE.

text: alccdf_melissa_validation S3 object (inherits alccdf_validation).

title: Validate Melissa geocoding results — melissa_validate
text: 3 checks performed : coordinate_bounds (ERROR): Latitude must within [30.14, 35.01] longitude within [-88.47, -84.89] (Alabama bounds). match_quality (WARN): Flags >10% rows poor Melissa match quality based RESULTCODE/STATUSCODE. id_match_rate (WARN): Reports percentage random_id values non-empty.

title: Clean raw program data — program_clean
text: cleaning pipeline applies following operations order: Standardise addresses (facility_address, physical_address) Create facility_address2 (standardised) Parse expiration_date compute days_till_expire Parse time fields create datetime versions Convert capacities integer + derive capacity variables Parse age ranges binary age-group indicators Compute operating hours (day/night) + operation type Recode facility_tier ordered factor (Star 1–5) quality metrics Standardise county factor (67 Alabama counties) Set region factor Assign facility_type factor using raw data values (preserves Family Home vs Group Home distinction) Convert children_under_12mo integer

title: Clean raw subsidy data — subsidy_clean
text: cleaning pipeline applies following operations order: PII Separation: Generate random IDs parent child. Move parent_name, child_name, parent_ssn, child_ssn separate PII table. Main data retains random IDs. Date Parsing: Parse parent_dob, child_dob, eligibility_begin_date, eligibility_end_date, placement_start_date, placement_end_date, placement_date character Date. Address Standardisation: Standardise family_address provider_address using .standardize_address(). Copayment Conversion: Convert copay_weekly numeric (clients data ). Age Conversion: Convert child_age numeric. County Standardisation: Title-case county names. Snapshot Date: Add snapshot_date column.

what: Generate Synthetic ALccdfDB Data for Demonstrations — synthetic-data
title: Generate Synthetic ALccdfDB Data for Demonstrations — synthetic-data
text: functions create realistic synthetic datasets mirror structure types real Alabama CCDF administrative data. useful demonstrations, vignettes, testing without requiring access confidential data files. four generators share facility identities called seed, enabling cross-module linkage (programs <-> enrolled <-> clients, programs <-> staff, programs <-> melissa). Creates synthetic alccdf_program_clean object realistic facility characteristics, capacity, operating hours, tier ratings, derived quality-adjusted capacity fields. Creates synthetic enrolled-children clients subsidy data PII separation, realistic dates, cross-module facility linkage. Creates synthetic alccdf_staff_clean object staff professional data, career lattice levels, PII separation. Uses facility names linkage key back programs. Creates synthetic Melissa.com geocoding results program addresses household (client) addresses. Returns plain tibbles (S3 objects) matching structure produced melissa_import_programs melissa_import_households.

title: Generate Synthetic ALccdfDB Data for Demonstrations — synthetic-data
code: alccdf_synthetic_programs(n = 50, seed = 42)  alccdf_synthetic_subsidy(n_enrolled = 80, n_clients = 40, seed = 42)  alccdf_synthetic_staff(n = 60, seed = 42)  alccdf_synthetic_melissa(programs = NULL, seed = 42)

title: Generate Synthetic ALccdfDB Data for Demonstrations — synthetic-data
text: n Integer. Number staff records. Default 60. seed Integer. Random seed reproducibility. Default 42. n_enrolled Integer. Number enrolled-children records. Default 80. n_clients Integer. Number client records. Default 40. programs optional alccdf_program_clean object. NULL (default), uses alccdf_synthetic_programs(seed = seed) generate addresses.

title: Generate Synthetic ALccdfDB Data for Demonstrations — synthetic-data

title: ALccdfDB 1.0.0 (2026-02-15)
text: Read, clean, validate, export 4 facility types (Centers, Family/Group Homes, Faith-Based Exempt, License Excepted). Auto-detection Excel format versions data-driven column mapping (11 CSV mapping files). Added program_append_types() unify facility types proper factor levels (Center, Family Home, Group Home, Faith-Based, Excepted). Added program_deduplicate() facility_id-based deduplication. Quality tier recoding: “None” -> NA, numeric -> ordered factor “Star 1” “Star 5”. 3 quality-adjusted capacity schemes: linear (0.2-1.0), binary (0.0/1.0), exponential (0.1-1.0). 28 derived analysis variables (capacity flags, age group indicators, operating hours, quality weights). Added program_summary_stats() comprehensive descriptive statistics. Added program_validate() 10 quality checks. 5 export formats: CSV, Excel, Stata (.dta), Parquet, RDS.

title: ALccdfDB 1.0.0 (2026-02-15)
text: Added subsidy_read() subsidy_clean() enrolled children client household records. PII separation: sensitive fields (names, SSNs) stored $pii, never $data. Random ID generation linking $data $pii. Added subsidy_validate(), subsidy_summary_stats(). 5 export formats (PII excluded default).

title: ALccdfDB 1.0.0 (2026-02-15)
text: Added staff_read() staff_clean() Alabama Pathways workforce registry. Career lattice level recoding (5 ordered levels). PII separation staff names emails. Added staff_validate(), staff_summary_stats(). 5 export formats (PII excluded default).

title: ALccdfDB 1.0.0 (2026-02-15)
text: Added melissa_import_programs() melissa_import_households() Melissa.com output. Added melissa_merge_programs() melissa_merge_households() address-based geocoding join. Address normalization pipeline matching. Added melissa_validate() geocoding quality checks. Provides latitude, longitude, census tract, FIPS code, address standardization.

title: ALccdfDB 1.0.0 (2026-02-15)
text: Added linkage_programs_enrolled() – join facility_id, aggregate enrollment counts care levels. Added linkage_programs_clients() – join provider_id, aggregate client counts copay. Added linkage_programs_staff() – join facility_name (case-insensitive), aggregate staff counts career levels. Added linkage_clients_programs() – reverse join, append program attributes client rows. Added linkage_report() cross-module match diagnostics. linkage type 5 export formats (20 export functions total).

title: ALccdfDB 1.0.0 (2026-02-15)
text: Added db_init() db_close() creating/opening DuckDB databases schema versioning. Added db_write_snapshot() persisting processed data timestamp tracking. Added db_read_snapshot() db_read_latest() retrieving stored data. Added db_list_tables(), db_list_snapshots(), db_table_info(), db_query() inspection SQL queries. DuckDB DBI optional dependencies (Suggests).

title: ALccdfDB 1.0.0 (2026-02-15)
text: Added alccdf_synthetic_programs(), alccdf_synthetic_subsidy(), alccdf_synthetic_staff(), alccdf_synthetic_melissa() generating realistic datasets without confidential DHR files. generators share common facility pool via seed, enabling cross-module linkage. Uses withr::with_seed() reproducibility.

title: ALccdfDB 1.0.0 (2026-02-15)
text: Added “Getting Started ALccdfDB” vignette – overview, synthetic data, facility types, quality tiers. Added “Complete Data Processing Pipeline” vignette – 3 modules 6 figures quality weight comparison. Added “Cross-Module Linkage Database Integration” vignette – 4 linkage types, Melissa geocoding, DuckDB/SQL.

title: ALccdfDB 1.0.0 (2026-02-15)
text: S3 object system: $data, $meta, $diagnostics structure alccdf_data() alccdf_meta() accessors. Codebook functions: alccdf_facility_type_levels(), alccdf_facility_tier_levels(). Generic export functions: export_csv(), export_excel(), export_stata(), export_parquet(), export_rds(), export_all(). Data-driven column mappings inst/extdata/ (11 mapping CSVs + 4 codebook CSVs).

title: ALccdfDB 1.0.0 (2026-02-15)
text: 95 exported functions, 34 R source files, ~9,765 lines code. 1,088 test expectations across 8 test files. 3 vignettes 12 inline ggplot2 figures. R CMD check: 0 errors, 0 warnings, 0 notes.
